trans.ptxt: The removal of paint and undercoating by stone chips immediately exposes metal to the atmosphere, causing it to oxidize. The thickness of this oxidation increases if the process continues unchecked. The soft chipping guard primer protects against damage due to the impact of such objects:

s1.ptxt: Sanding the replacement part.Use a double action sander and grit sandpaper.

item.ptxt: Do not oversand the edges or corners of the part.

s1.ptxt: Air blowing/degreasing.Use alcohol, and wax and grease remover.
Protect from overspray.Use masking tape and paper to protect the related areas from overspray.

item.ptxt: Spray about four to five coats to get microns of thickness. One coat deposits about to microns.
Do not try to cover the surface with one heavy coat. Applying several thin coats is recommended.
Use a 2-part urethane primer surfacer and a spray gun.
Mix the primer surfacer with the correct ratio of additive and solvent.
Follow the primer surfacer manufacturer's instructions.

s1.ptxt: Drying.After spraying primer surfacer, allow to minutes of drying time, then force dry it with infrared lamps or an industrial dryer.

item.ptxt: Check that the primer surfacer has dried thoroughly, then sand the primer surfacer.
Use a double action sander and grit sandpaper.
